text: Bluesology is an album by pianist George Cables recorded in 1997 and released on the Danish label, SteepleChase.SteepleChase Productions ApS, accessed April 19, 2017George Cables discography, accessed April 19, 2017 == Reception == Ken Dryden of AllMusic stated "This is one of a series of excellent trio dates made by pianist George Cables for Steeplechase during his tenure with the Danish label". In JazzTimes Miles Jordan called it a "compelling and rewarding disc" and wrote "His imaginative, protean approach to music consistently rewards the listener".Jordan, M. JazzTimes Review, accessed April 19, 2017 On All About Jazz C. Andrew Hovan said "Bluesology is a distinguished Cables affair while also being just one damn good piano trio record. The focus is mainly on standards, but what this ensemble does with them is anything but standard fare".Hovan, C. A. All About Jazz Review, accessed April 19, 2017 == Track listing == # "In Your Own Sweet Way" (Dave Brubeck) – 6:50 # "Easy Living" (Ralph Rainger, Leo Robin) – 6:41 # "There Is No Greater Love" (Isham Jones, Marty Symes) – 5:41 # "Voodoo Lady" (George Cables) – 5:12 # "Come Rain or Come Shine" (Harold Arlen, Johnny Mercer) – 8:10 # "A Night in Tunisia" (Dizzy Gillespie) – 8:00 # "Hi-Fly" (Randy Weston) – 7:23 # "Bluesology" (Milt Jackson) – 7:34 # "Ebony Moonbeams" (Cables) – 9:02 # "How Deep Is the Ocean?" (Irving Berlin) – 4:48 == Personnel == *George Cables – piano *Jay Anderson – bass *Billy Drummond – drums == References == Category:George Cables albums Category:1998 albums Category:SteepleChase Records albums
title: Bluesology (album)
